p: This predicted decline of the Yellow‐bellied Sapsucker climatically suitable range appears to be supported by climate–forest projections. The tree species most associated with their mixed‐forest breeding habitat (quaking aspen ( Populus tremuloides), red maple ( Acer rubrum), yellow birch ( Betula alleghaniensis), and paper birch ( Betula papyrifera); Walters et al., 2002) will shift north with concurrent contractions in climatically suitable ranges (except: red maple range will increase) according to bioclimatic niche tree models (McKenney et al., 2007). Southern limited species (e.g., sugar maple ( Acer saccharum), American basswood ( Tillia americana), and bitternut hickory ( Carya cordiformis); McKenney et al., 2007; Terrier, Girardin, Perie, Legendre, & Bergeron, 2013) will expand north, causing a tree composition change toward more deciduous dominance (Terrier et al., 2013).
